intro: Solanum indicum var. kandtii, commonly known as the Indian nightshade, is a species native to parts of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into berries, which are typically red when ripe. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their medicinal properties. Due to its toxic compounds, it is important to handle the plant with care.
